intro: Lomatogonium sichuanense, commonly known as the Sichuan lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often branched stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Lomatogonium sichuanense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
